verses.verse: Woe<WH1945> to the bloody<WH1818> city,<WH5892> completely<WH3605> full<WH4392> of lies<WH3585> [and] pillage;<WH6563> [Her] prey<WH2964> never<WH3808> departs.<WH4185>
The noise<WH6963> of the whip,<WH7752> The noise<WH6963> of the rattling<WH7494> of the wheel,<WH212> Galloping<WH1725> horses,<WH5483> And bounding<WH7540> chariots!<WH4818>

Horsemen<WH6571> charging,<WH5927> Swords<WH2719> flashing,<WH3851> spears<WH2595> gleaming,<WH1300> Many<WH7230> slain,<WH2491> a mass<WH3514> of corpses,<WH6297> And countless<WH369> <WH9523> dead<WH1472> bodies<WH1472> – They stumble<WH3782> over the dead<WH1472> bodies!<WH1472>

[All] because<WH4480> of the many<WH7230> harlotries<WH2183> of the harlot,<WH2181> The charming<WH2580> <WH2896> one,<WH2896> the mistress<WH1172> of sorceries,<WH3785> Who sells<WH4376> nations<WH1471> by her harlotries<WH2183> And families<WH4940> by her sorceries.<WH3785>

"Behold,<WH2009> I am against<WH413> you," declares<WH5002> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts;<WH6635> "And I will lift<WH1540> up your skirts<WH7757> over<WH5921> your face,<WH6440> And show<WH7200> to the nations<WH1471> your nakedness<WH4626> And to the kingdoms<WH4467> your disgrace.<WH7036>
"I will throw<WH7993> filth<WH8251> on you And make<WH9310> you vile,<WH9310> And set<WH7760> you up as a spectacle.<WH7210>

"And it will come<WH1961> about that all<WH3605> who see<WH7200> you Will shrink<WH5074> from you and say,<WH559> 'Nineveh<WH5210> is devastated!<WH7703> Who<WH4310> will grieve<WH5110> for her?' Where<WH370> will I seek<WH1245> comforters<WH5162> for you?"

Are you better<WH3190> than<WH4480> No-amon, Which was situated<WH3427> by the waters<WH4325> of the Nile,<WH2975> With water<WH4325> surrounding<WH5439> her, Whose<WH834> rampart<WH2426> [was] the sea,<WH3220> Whose wall<WH2346> [consisted] of the sea<WH3220>?
Ethiopia<WH3568> was [her] might,<WH6109> And Egypt<WH4714> too, without<WH369> limits.<WH9523> Put<WH6316> and Lubim<WH3864> were among her helpers.<WH5833>

Yet<WH1571> she became an exile,<WH1473> She went<WH1980> into captivity;<WH7628> Also<WH1571> her small children<WH5768> were dashed<WH7376> to pieces<WH7376> At the head<WH7218> of every<WH3605> street;<WH2351> They cast<WH3032> lots<WH1486> for her honorable<WH3513> men, And all<WH3605> her great<WH1419> men<WH1419> were bound<WH7576> with fetters.<WH9108>
You too<WH1571> will become<WH7937> drunk,<WH7937> You will be hidden.<WH5956> You too<WH1571> will search<WH1245> for a refuge<WH4581> from the enemy.<WH340>
All<WH3605> your fortifications<WH4013> are fig<WH8384> trees<WH8384> with ripe<WH1061> fruit<WH1061> – When<WH518> shaken,<WH5128> they fall<WH5307> into the eater's mouth.<WH6310>

Behold,<WH2009> your people<WH5971> are women<WH802> in your midst!<WH7130> The gates<WH8179> of your land<WH776> are opened<WH6605> wide<WH6605> to your enemies;<WH340> Fire<WH784> consumes<WH398> your gate bars.<WH1280>

Draw<WH7579> for yourself water<WH4325> for the siege!<WH4692> Strengthen<WH2388> your fortifications!<WH4013> Go<WH935> into the clay<WH2916> and tread<WH7429> the mortar!<WH2563> Take<WH2388> hold<WH2388> of the brick<WH4404> mold!<WH4404>

There<WH8033> fire<WH784> will consume<WH398> you, The sword<WH2719> will cut<WH3772> you down;<WH3772> It will consume<WH398> you as the locust<WH3218> [does.] Multiply<WH3513> yourself like the creeping<WH3218> locust,<WH3218> Multiply<WH3513> yourself like the swarming<WH697> locust.<WH697>
You have increased<WH7235> your traders<WH7402> more<WH4480> than<WH4480> the stars<WH3556> of heaven<WH8064> – The creeping<WH3218> locust<WH3218> strips<WH6584> and flies<WH5774> away.<WH5774>

Your guardsmen<WH4502> are like the swarming<WH697> locust.<WH697> Your marshals<WH2951> are like hordes<WH1462> of grasshoppers<WH1462> Settling<WH2583> in the stone walls<WH1448> on a cold<WH7135> day.<WH3117> The sun<WH8121> rises<WH2224> and they flee,<WH5074> And the place<WH4725> where<WH335> they are is not known.<WH3045>

Your shepherds<WH7462> are sleeping,<WH5123> O king<WH4428> of Assyria;<WH804> Your nobles<WH117> are lying<WH7931> down.<WH7931> Your people<WH5971> are scattered<WH9448> on the mountains,<WH2022> And there<WH369> is no<WH369> one<WH369> to regather<WH6908> [them.]

There<WH369> is no<WH369> relief<WH3545> for your breakdown,<WH7667> Your wound<WH4347> is incurable.<WH2470> All<WH3605> who hear<WH8085> about<WH8088> you Will clap<WH8628> [their] hands<WH3709> over<WH5921> you, For on whom<WH4310> has not your evil<WH9567> passed<WH5674> continually<WH8548>?
